stimulusHtml: Assume a consumer is spending all her income on two goods: X and Y. At the current consumption combination of the two goods, if the marginal utility per dollar spent on the last unit of good X exceeds that of the marginal utility per dollar spent on the last unit of good Y, what should the consumer do to maximize utility?
choicesHtml: Purchase more units of X and more units of Y.
Decrease the price of good X.
Purchase more units of X and less units of Y.
Increase income to buy more of both good Y and good X.
Nothing; utility is maximized at current consumption bundles.
